subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove.
I know I haven't posted any “In Presence” videos for a while and there's a reason for this.
I'm in the process of evaluating where we go from here with the New Thinking Allowed channel.
You probably have noticed that I've been posting video nuggets.
The reason that I do that is I realize the average viewer watches for just 10 minutes
and the average regular New Thinking Allowed interview is now running 30 to 40 minutes.
So, I thought it might be nice to take some of the highlights, 5-6 minute highlights,
from the interviews and make them available for people who have a shorter attention span
- don't want to watch the full half-hour.
I'm trying to do that with just about all of the videos, so that's an ongoing effort
on my part.
The other thing I've come to realize - it's been quite an experimental year this year.
First of all, we moved from Las Vegas to Albuquerque and set up a studio right here in the house.
In Las Vegas it used to be in an office building, but that's all changed.
But, even more than that the creation of this “In Presence” series within the New Thinking
Allowed channel - that's been an innovation, a big innovation for me because I've been
an interviewer since 1972.
But, this is the first time that I'm actually giving voice to my own thoughts, doing monologues
like this.
Although, it's kind of natural for me.
I've been a lecturer and a public speaker all of my professional life.
So, I'm happy to do it.
But, at this point now since March, over a hundred and fifty of these “In Presence”
videos have been released covering all sorts of things.
I mean, certainly a lot of historical, scientific, cultural material of an academic or an intellectual
nature.
I suppose in a way that's my forte, that's my strong point.
But, I've also posted karaoke videos, I've spoken a little bit and then attempted to
exercise a certain amount of psychic chat transmission, or, spiritual channeling is
part of these videos.
Let me just say, I don't want to make much of it.
I don't even think I need to talk about it anymore.
But, I do it every single time I'm in front of the camera.
It just seems to come out of me.
You know, I could just do videos talking about that.
I sometimes wonder…
I started to do it.
If you go to “In Presence” 0092, that was the turning point.
I really got into this much more intuitive mode, which, as the past president of the
Intuition Network, it's kind of a natural for me.
I don't mind pushing that further.
But, at the same time, I realized probably - and I've gotten feedback as well, I’ll admit -
that my great strength as an interviewer and as a video host is that I do prepare
a lot more than most people do.
I think that preparation really shows when I do an interview or even an “In Presence”
monologue.
I think that the more preparation that goes into them the better.
Since I'm concerned with the quality of what goes out on this channel I expect that I'll
be doing fewer videos.
So, I don't have that pressure on myself to do a new monologue every single day.
Fewer videos, but of higher quality.
In the meantime, I do plan to keep those video nuggets going.
One other change I'd like to make is this: I have some great guests lined up.
I have Eben Alexander coming in a few weeks, who is the author of Proof of Heaven and The
Map of Heaven.
I'd be very happy for those of you who are familiar with his work and have some thoughtful
questions, why don't you post them to me?
I’d recommend that if you do that, post them to me on email - there's a link inside
of the “About” section on the New Thinking Allowed channel homepage.
Or, you can just post them on the comments that follow this “In Presence,” if you
have questions or ideas that you think would be relevant when I interview Eben Alexander.
I'd be happy to know what your thoughts are.
I've come to realize that amongst the viewers are a number of people who are highly educated,
often more well-read than I am on particular topics.
It can be a community effort.
I'll probably benefit from having you pose some questions.
I may work with those questions.
I don't work with notes at all when I do the interviews, but if I decide to work with the
questions posted I'm very likely going to give some of you credit for offering those
questions.
I might mention, as well, in addition to Eben Alexander - I don't have a date yet set - but,
I expect in the next six weeks or so to have a visit from Whitley Strieber, the author
of Communion and Breakthrough - a person who has done probably more than anybody to awaken
people’s awareness to the issue of UFO abductees and contactees.
So, I'm looking forward to interviewing him as well.
In addition, I expect to be seeing Pierre Grimes, that 94 year old philosopher and specialist
in ancient Greek philosophy, in particular.
A delightful man and he'll be coming back again.
I know many of you have posted thoughtful comments on the previous discussions
I've had with him.
I expect I may have more visits in the future from Joanna Harcourt-Smith, Timothy Leary's
former common-law wife.
She has a lot to say about ecology, about the Earth, and about psychedelics, as well
as her previous life with Timothy Leary.
Her book, Tripping the Bardo with Timothy Leary, reveals a great deal about her background
as an upper upper class jetsetter and the enormous self-revelation she's had coming
to terms with her own background.
So, some of you may have questions you'd like me to pose to her as well.
So, I’m happy to see the audience become more engaged.
One other thing I might mention... because this article that I have mentioned, the very
significant meta meta analysis, an analysis of the dozen-or-so meta-analyses that have
been published covering 1,700 parapsychological experiments published in refereed scientific
journals with extraordinary rigor, good experimental methodology, and very significant statistical
results.
So, that is a landmark publication and it's making me think about whether or not this
is a time for me to try to combine another field about which I have quite a passionate
interest, which is financial forecasting.
I'm linking right now to my website, The Alpha Interface, and the three books - Kindle books
- I have released on financial forecasting.
Well, I'm looking at now doing more in that area and integrating it with the work in remote
viewing.
Maybe create a special online course for financial professionals who would like to have remote
viewing as part of their repertoire, another arrow in their quiver, so to speak.
So, if I do that now or something along those lines, which I am tempted to do, it will mean
I'll be taking some time away from all of the activity of the New Thinking Allowed channel
for a while.
Which is another good reason to put you fewer videos up, but to make sure they are of the
highest quality that I can muster.
So, those are my thoughts.
What's in this for you?
Well, one thing is, yes, you can become more actively involved by posting questions that
I might be able to ask some of our upcoming interviewees.
And maybe give yourself... ask yourself this question.
Are there things in your life that you are in the habit of doing, day after day after
day, that maybe you are at a point now where you could slow down, do them less often,
don't put so much pressure on yourself, think about quality more than quantity.
Are there things like that in your life?
I'll leave you with that thought.
And once again, thank you for being with me.
